block.p: The food situation for the average Soviet shopper is unpredictable at best, as shown by these figures from government stores and farm markets, where state price controls do not apply. The information was collected by reporters for The New York Times and, at The Times's request, reporters for local papers.
Also noted are measures to relieve shortages.
The average Soviet wage is about 250 rubles a month, and the minimum pension is 70 rubles a month. Most families have two wage-earners, and many have outside income from moonlighting. MOSCOW

Government Store At Universal Food Store, west Moscow: yogurt, milk, bread, dry baby food, plum juice, tomato juice, apples, tangerines, garlic, carrots. 3-hour line for pork. Shortages: eggs, milk. Farm Market Prices: beef, 3.50 rubles a pound, pork 4.50 rubles a pound, eggs Beef 9.00-10.00 rubles a pound Pork* 12.00 rubles a pound Eggs 12.00 rubles a dozen *Pork was 0.86 ruble a pound in the government store. Special Measures Proof of Moscow residence required for purchase of most goods. Rationing of sugar. Wider rationing contemplated. MURMANSK Government Store At Universal Store, southern Murmansk: sugar, eggs, tea, sausage, cereals, macaroni (all for rationing coupons). 40-minute line for sour cream. No meat. Shoppers ignore very expensive frozen salmon. Shortage: vegetable oil. Farm Market Prices Pork 10.70 rubles a pound Eggs Not Available. Special Measures Rationing of 14 items, including chicken, sugar, eggs, tea, cereals, rice, macaroni, sausage, cigarettes, matches. Additional rationing starting Jan. 1. UZHGOROD Government Store At Ossetiya, in a residential neighborhood: chickens, bologna, ground pork and beef cutlets, canned vegetables, cereals, macaroni, noodles, breads and pastries. Dairy store has milk in mornings. Vegetable store has eight types of produce 40-minute line for sausage. Shortages: eggs, butter. Farm Market Prices Boneless pork 5.50 rubles a pound Eggs 8.40 rubles a dozen Special Measures Wage-earners receive coupons equal to 70 percent of salaries. Coupons must be used with rubles for most purchases. TOMSK Government Store At Tsentral Gastronom: tomato joice, apples, oat cereal, bread. Line of 60 people for soup bones. 50 people for sugar. No meat or dairy products. Shortages: butter, oil, chicken, eggs. Farm Market Prices Pork 3.60 rubles a pound Beef 4.00 rubles pound. Eggs Not available. Special Measures Rationing of butter, cereals, flour, tea, sugar, macaroni. TALLINN Government Store Janseni store in residential neighborhood: three types of cheese, three types of fresh fish, pork three tyupes of sausage, a range of dairy products. Latest shortages: eggs, white bread. Farm Market Prices Pork 4.00 rubles a pound Lamb 4.00 rubles a pound Eggs 4.80 rubles a dozen *Pork was 2.40 rubles a pound in the government store. Special Measures: State doubled or tripled prices on mosts basic foods in October. Rationing of sugar and flour. Customs posts set up to block exports to other republics. TASHKENT Government Store At Rabochy Gorodok Food Store: potatoes, hot dogs (sold out), five types of canned foods, seasonal fruits and vegetables. Shortages: eggs, dairy products, vegetable oil. Farm Market Prices Beef 6 rubles a pound Mutton 7.50 rubles a pound Smoked pork 9.70 rubles a pound Eggs 6.60 rubles a dozen. Special Measures Rationing coupons for sugar, meat and detergents.
